# ai-skills — full API reference

> 10 artifact-producing skills for AI agents. Generates files LLMs cannot produce from their token stream. MCP server or TypeScript library. Zero external dependencies.

## Connect (MCP)

Add to any MCP-compatible agent config:

```json
{ "command": "npx", "args": ["ai-skills"] }
```

Exposes 10 tools: `generate_qr_code`, `build_pdf`, `build_spreadsheet`, `generate_ical`, `generate_chart`, `generate_vcard`, `generate_barcode`, `generate_wav`, `generate_hash`, `create_zip`. The agent discovers and calls them automatically.

## Import (library)

```typescript
import { skills } from "ai-skills";
```

---

## skills.generateQrCode(input)

Generate a QR code as SVG.

**Input:**
- `data` (string, required) — text or URL to encode
- `size` (number, default: 256) — image width/height in pixels
- `ecl` ("L" | "M" | "Q" | "H", default: "M") — error correction level
- `fg` (string, default: "#000000") — foreground color hex
- `bg` (string, default: "#ffffff") — background color hex

**Returns:** SVG string

```typescript
skills.generateQrCode({ data: "https://example.com", size: 300, ecl: "H" })
```

---

## skills.buildPdf(input)

Generate a PDF document from structured content.

**Input:**
- `title` (string, optional) — document title
- `author` (string, optional) — author name
- `date` (string, optional) — document date
- `body` (array, required) — content blocks:
  - `string` — paragraph text
  - `{ heading: string }` — section heading
  - `{ table: { headers: string[], rows: string[][] } }` — table
  - `{ list: string[] }` — bullet list
- `footer` (string, optional) — footer text, `{page}` for page number
- `pageSize` ("letter" | "a4", default: "letter")

**Returns:** `{ base64: string, size: number, pages: number }`

```typescript
skills.buildPdf({
  title: "Report",
  body: ["Paragraph.", { heading: "Section" }, { list: ["A", "B"] }],
})
```

---

## skills.buildSpreadsheet(input)

Generate a CSV or TSV spreadsheet.

**Input:**
- `headers` (string[], required)
- `rows` ((string | number | null)[][], required)
- `summary` (Record<string, "sum" | "avg" | "min" | "max" | "count">, optional)
- `format` ("csv" | "tsv", default: "csv")
- `formulas` (boolean, default: false) — process `=SUM`, `{row}` placeholders
- `bom` (boolean, default: false) — UTF-8 BOM for Excel

**Returns:** CSV/TSV string

```typescript
skills.buildSpreadsheet({
  headers: ["Name", "Q1", "Q2"],
  rows: [["Alice", 100, 120], ["Bob", 80, 90]],
  summary: { Q1: "sum", Q2: "sum" },
})
```

## skills.generateIcal(input)

Generate an iCalendar (.ics) file. RFC 5545 compliant.

**Input:**
- `events` (array, required):
  - `summary` (string, required)
  - `start` (string, required) — ISO 8601
  - `end` (string, required) — ISO 8601
  - `description`, `location`, `timezone`, `organizer`, `attendees`, `alarm`, `rrule`, `status`, `url` — all optional
- `calendar_name` (string, optional)
- `method` (string, optional)

**Returns:** .ics string

```typescript
skills.generateIcal({
  events: [{ summary: "Meeting", start: "2025-03-15T14:00:00", end: "2025-03-15T15:00:00", timezone: "America/New_York" }],
})
```

---

## skills.generateChart(input)

Generate an SVG chart from data.

**Input:**
- `type` ("bar" | "line" | "pie" | "scatter", required)
- `data` — `Record<string, number>` for bar/pie, `number[][]` for line/scatter
- `title` (string, optional)
- `width` (number, default: 600)
- `height` (number, default: 400)
- `colors` (string[], optional)

**Returns:** SVG string

```typescript
skills.generateChart({ type: "bar", data: { Q1: 100, Q2: 200 }, title: "Revenue" })
```

---

## skills.generateVCard(input)

Generate a vCard 4.0 (.vcf) contact file. RFC 6350 compliant.

**Input:**
- `name` ({ given: string, family: string, prefix?: string, suffix?: string }, required)
- `org` (string, optional)
- `title` (string, optional)
- `email` (string | string[], optional)
- `phone` (string | string[], optional)
- `address` ({ street?, city?, state?, zip?, country? }, optional)
- `url` (string, optional)
- `note` (string, optional)
- `photo_base64` (string, optional) — base64-encoded image

**Returns:** .vcf string

```typescript
skills.generateVCard({
  name: { given: "Alice", family: "Smith" },
  org: "Acme Corp",
  email: "alice@example.com",
  phone: "+1-555-0100",
})
```

---

## skills.generateBarcode(input)

Generate a Code128 1D barcode as SVG.

**Input:**
- `data` (string, required) — text to encode (printable ASCII)
- `width` (number, default: 300) — image width in pixels
- `height` (number, default: 80) — bar height in pixels
- `show_text` (boolean, default: true) — show text label below barcode

**Returns:** SVG string

```typescript
skills.generateBarcode({ data: "ABC-12345", width: 400, height: 100 })
```

---

## skills.generateWav(input)

Generate a WAV audio file (tone/beep).

**Input:**
- `frequency` (number, required) — Hz (20–20000)
- `duration` (number, required) — seconds (0–30)
- `sample_rate` (number, default: 44100)
- `volume` (number, default: 0.8) — 0.0–1.0
- `waveform` ("sine" | "square" | "sawtooth", default: "sine")

**Returns:** `{ base64: string, size: number, duration: number, frequency: number }`

```typescript
skills.generateWav({ frequency: 440, duration: 1.0, waveform: "sine" })
```

---

## skills.generateHash(input)

Compute a cryptographic hash or HMAC signature.

**Input:**
- `data` (string, required)
- `algorithm` ("sha256" | "sha512" | "md5" | "sha1", default: "sha256")
- `encoding` ("hex" | "base64", default: "hex")
- `hmac_key` (string, optional) — if provided, computes HMAC

**Returns:** `{ hash: string, algorithm: string, encoding: string, hmac: boolean }`

```typescript
skills.generateHash({ data: "hello world", algorithm: "sha256" })
skills.generateHash({ data: "message", algorithm: "sha256", hmac_key: "secret" })
```

---

## skills.createZip(input)

Create a ZIP archive from file entries.

**Input:**
- `files` (array, required):
  - `name` (string) — file path within archive
  - `content` (string) — file content

**Returns:** `{ base64: string, size: number, entries: number }`

```typescript
skills.createZip({
  files: [
    { name: "readme.txt", content: "Hello world" },
    { name: "data.csv", content: "a,b\n1,2" },
  ],
})
```

---

## Add a skill

Drop a folder into `skills/<name>/` with:
- `SKILL.md` — frontmatter (`name`, `description`) + instructions
- `scripts/<script>.ts` — implementation

The MCP server and library API pick it up automatically.
